security_audit.summary: This skill is documentation and examples for Payload CMS usage. No executable scripts, obfuscation, or suspicious automation are present. No indicators of data theft or malicious execution were found.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS features with proven patterns
content.value_statement: Payload configuration and API details can be hard to recall under time pressure. This skill provides clear patterns and examples for collections, fields, hooks, access control, and queries.
actual_capabilities: Explain collection configuration patterns, including auth, drafts, and uploads
Provide field definitions and validation guidance for common field types
Describe hook usage and context patterns to avoid infinite loops
Outline access control strategies and query constraints
Guide adapter setup for database, storage, and email providers
limitations: Does not run code or connect to live Payload instances
Cannot verify environment variables or secrets in your system
Recommendations rely on the provided project context
Does not replace official Payload documentation for edge cases

use_cases.title: Design collections fast
use_cases.description: Create collection and field configs with reliable patterns for auth, drafts, and relationships.

use_cases.title: Review access control
use_cases.description: Check role and row level access rules for common security pitfalls.

use_cases.title: Plan plugin structure
use_cases.description: Outline plugin architecture, hooks, and extension points for Payload packages.

prompt_templates.title: Start a collection
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Payload collection for blog posts with title, slug, content, author relation, and draft support.

prompt_templates.title: Add access control
prompt_templates.prompt: Add access control so public users see published posts, and admins can read all posts.

prompt_templates.title: Fix a hook issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to prevent a Payload afterChange hook from triggering itself and show a safe pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced query guidance
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a Payload query that filters posts by author name, published status, and date range using AND and OR.

output_examples.input: Help me configure access control for a members only collection
output: Define roles and a read access function
Return true for admins and subscribed users
Return a query constraint for active subscriptions
Add notes about overrideAccess in local API calls

best_practices: Provide the Payload version and adapter details in your request
Share relevant collection or field schemas for accurate guidance
State whether the operation is local API, REST, or GraphQL
anti_patterns: Requesting secret values or environment variable contents
Asking to bypass access control for user facing operations
Providing no schema context and expecting exact code

faq.question: Is this compatible with Payload 3.x?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance targets Payload 3.x patterns shown in the skill content.

faq.question: Are there limits on request size?
faq.answer: Large schemas should be trimmed to the relevant sections for best results.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing Payload projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Provide your current config files and collection context.

faq.question: Does it access my data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. It only uses the text you provide in the conversation.

faq.question: What if the guidance does not work?
faq.answer: Share the error message and the related config snippet for troubleshooting.

faq.question: How does it compare to the docs?
faq.answer: It summarizes and applies the docs to your specific use case.
